definitions.definition: ( cricket ) The action of the batsman not attempting to play at the ball.
examples: He made 45 leaves in his innings of 64.

definitions.definition: ( billiards ) The arrangement of balls in play that remains after a shot is made (which determines whether the next shooter — who may be either the same player, or an opponent — has good options, or only poor ones).
( Scrabble ) The tiles remaining on a player's rack after his or her turn .
examples: I didn't score much, but LING was a good leave .

main_definition: ( cricket ) The action of the batsman not attempting to play at the ball.
secondary_definitions: ( billiards ) The arrangement of balls in play that remains after a shot is made (which determines whether the next shooter — who may be either the same player, or an opponent — has good options, or only poor ones).
( Scrabble ) The tiles remaining on a player's rack after his or her turn .

definitions.definition: Permission to be absent; time away from one's work .
examples: I've just been given three weeks' leave by my boss -I don't think I still have some leave owing to me.
Might I beg leave to accompany you?
The applicant now seeks leave to appeal and, if leave be granted, to appeal against these sentences.
I took my leave of the gentleman without a backward glance.

main_definition: Permission to be absent; time away from one's work .
